intro: Canarium apoense, commonly known as the Philippine candlenut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil, while the tree also plays a role in local ecosystems. Canarium apoense is often found in lowland and montane forests, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
